page.title: 12A STREET IN HESSLE
page.content: There are about 120 houses in our street (Barrow Lane). Some of them were built in 1888 and are almost 100 years old. There are no shops in Barrow Lane. There are no buildings for special purposes. All of the houses are made of brick. Most of the roof tiles are made of slate. Nearly all the houses have gardens with fences or hedges round them. It is a straight, quiet, narrow road. There are drainage grids with iron bars across. The surface of the road is slighly higher in the middle so that the water can run off. It has sodium lamps which have timers to turn them on and off. It has a few trees on either side.
